page.title: 15Clubs in Stock
page.content: The Present secretary of Stock Cricket Club is Tony Bradbury and they field four teams whose members live in or around Stock.During the First World War no Cricket was played because the cricket ground was used by the army as an Artillery Range.After the war the War Office payed Â£10.11 shillings to repair the pitch. The unemployed men in the village did the work.50 years ago houses in Stock had no piped water.The foot path to the village pump ran right across the middle of the pitch so the game often had to be stopped while villagers went to collect water.The pitch is on common land with rent payable to Lord Petre of Ingatestone Hall.
